title: 騰訊確定將會代理中國行版 Nintendo Switch

replies.msg:
TOKYO— Nintendo Co. has submitted a request to the Chinese government for approval to sell its Switch console in China, a spokesman said, potentially opening up a major market long closed to the Japanese videogame maker’s flagship consoles.

The spokesman said Nintendo would collaborate in the business with Tencent Holdings Ltd. , one of China’s top technology companies, which already operates a big videogame business.

Nintendo’s Switch, its flagship machine, has generally sold well around the world since its introduction in March 2017. The company reported cumulative sales of 32.3 million as of Dec. 31, 2018.

But until now, Nintendo has held off in bringing the Switch to the world’s most populous country, a major source of revenue for other technology companies such as Apple Inc. Nintendo’s chief executive, Shuntaro Furukawa, had said he wasn’t ready until Nintendo lined up a good partner.

In January 2014, China effectively lifted a 14-year prohibition on sales of videogame consoles. Eight months later Microsoft Corp. started selling its Xbox One there, followed by Sony Corp. with its PlayStation 4.
